definitions.definition: the fact or process of doing something, typically to achieve an aim.
examples: he vowed to take tougher action against persistent offenders
synonyms: operation "the need for local community action"

definitions.definition: the way in which something such as a chemical has an effect or influence.
examples: the seeds require the catalytic action of water to release hotness
synonyms: working; power "the action of hormones on the pancreas"

definitions.definition: the events represented in a story or play.
examples: the action is set in the country
the nonstop action of mountain biking
synonyms: incidents; informalgoings-on "he missed all the action while he was away"

definitions.definition: used by a movie director as a command to begin.

synonyms: activity "there can be no excuse for their actions"

definitions.definition: a manner or style of doing something, typically the way in which a mechanism works or a person moves.
examples: a high paddle action in canoeing

definitions.definition: the mechanism that makes a machine or instrument work.
examples: a piano with an escapement action
